page.title: 15Changes in Upper Strensham
page.content: Certain buildings and land are on the brink of change in 1985. The public house, which has been closed for several years, has a new owner, who has been granted a licence. It is due to open during August as a public house and resturant. The Village Hall, an ex-army hut from the Great War needs rebuilding. Applications have been made for grants, and a 100 club has been started to fund the alterations and provide sanitation. The C18 alms houses are roofless and derelict. Grants have now been promised to the trustees, who are responsible to the charity commission. Tenders are now out for the conversion of this listed building into 3 modern almshouses. There are also tentative plans for further housing development on the unused land which was once the site of Strensham Court.
